snippet: In arguments made against the Obama administration’s health care law, a thread that runs through many of them is an analogy between the health care law and broccoli.
abstract: Thread that runs through many of the arguments made against the Obama administration’s health care law is an analogy between the law and broccoli; many lawyers say if the Supreme Court strikes down the law, one cause would be a long case history referring to broccoli and the right of Americans to choose what their own path; vegetable trail leads back to the early 1990s through conservative media and pundits.
lead_paragraph: In arguments made against the Obama administration’s health care law, a thread that runs through many of them is an analogy between the health care law and broccoli.

headline.seo: How Broccoli Became a Symbol in the Health Care Debate
headline.main: How Broccoli Landed on Supreme Court Menu
headline.print_headline: How Broccoli Landed on Supreme Court Menu

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
